{"step_by_step_thinking": "A free-way space refers to the space between the upper and lower teeth when the jaw is in a relaxed position. In complete dentures, a free-way space of 2-4 mm is recommended. If the free-way space is less than normal, it can lead to occlusal interferences and instability of the denture. This can result in increased muscle activity and discomfort for the patient. Based on this information, the adverse result of a free-way space of less than normal in complete denture would likely be mucosal irritation.", "answer_choice": "A"}
